meanings.definition: To cover or obscure something completely.
meanings.sent1: She blankest the painting with a thick cloth.
meanings.sent2: The fog blankest the entire city, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent3: The magician blankest the rabbit with a big hat, making it disappear.
meanings.sent4: The darkness blankest the room like a heavy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The snowstorm blankest the landscape in a sea of white.

meanings.sent1: His blankest face showed no emotion at all.
meanings.sent2: The movie was so boring, it left me with the blankest expression.
meanings.sent3: The blankest party I've ever been to had no music or decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her blankest response to the joke made everyone wonder if she understood it.
meanings.sent5: The blankest book I've read had no plot or characters to care about.

meanings.sent1: The blankest on the map indicated unexplored territory.
meanings.sent2: She stared at the blankest on the wall, unsure of what to draw.
meanings.sent3: The blankest in the puzzle was the hardest to fill in.
meanings.sent4: The blankest in the field seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent5: The blankest in the painting left room for imagination to run wild.

meanings.definition: To become white or pale in color.
meanings.sent1: The fabric blankest after being washed with bleach.
meanings.sent2: His face blankest when he heard the shocking news.
meanings.sent3: The flowers blankest under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent4: The sky blankest as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph blankest over time, losing its original colors.
